snippet: Investigators are increasingly finding evidence of prescription, over-the-counter and illicit drugs in pilots who die in accidents, officials say.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board study reports that pilots killed in airplane crashes in 2012 tested positive for drug four times more often than those killled in 1990.
lead_paragraph: Investigators are increasingly finding evidence of prescription, over-the-counter and illicit drugs in pilots who die in accidents, officials say.

headline.main: Rise in Drug Use Is Found in Pilots Killed in Crashes
headline.print_headline: Study of Pilots Killed in Crashes Reveals Big Jump in Drug Use
